description:
The object of the game is to become a successful Pop Group Manager, by gaining control of as many Groups as possible, and obtaining the cards for as many Cities marked on the board as you can. The ultimate success is to become a "Millionaire".

Imagine you are the manager of your favourite "Pop" group and that they are giving performances in the various cities where your counter lands.

Money is made from Group performance fees and 'Hire of Hall' charges, received when a player has the exclusive performance rights for a particular city. Fees are doubled if the rights for all four cities in a country are held.

TINY GARDEN GROWERS

Game Summary
Tiny Garden Growers is a game about growing vegetable plants and harvesting the vegetables.
This is a dice rolling and placement game that also uses dexterity and counting skills.

Number of players: 2-3
Components: 1 game board and 50 dice (30 green or white, 10 red, 10 yellow) and rules!
Playing time: 10 to 15 minutes

CASTLE UNDER SIEGE

Castle under Siege is an 18-card - 1 or 2-player Dexterity Medieval Castle Siege game.

Player-1 controls the Catapult and tries to loft "boulder, fireball, and disease" towards a castle. You use one of the cards as an actual catapult; tossing ammunition at the castle.

Player-2 maintains the castle and must use his forces to put out fires, repair boulder damage, and take card of the injured soldiers. To do this you must move around the castle trying to reach and resolve each situation before it gets out of control. All the while trying to stay alive because if a boulder lands in an area where your forces are they are either killed or injured.

You have a limited supply of ammunition and once you run out the game is over. You tally your score to see if you breached the castle wall or tower. Or see how many forces you were able to kill!

The player of the castle wins by preventing a wall or tower breach and trying to save as many soldiers as possible.

Tong is a print and play game from Bruno Cathala illustrated by Camille Chaussy.

At your turn, feed your chameleon then move it (from the number of insects the chameleon has eaten). The first who can't feed the animals loses the game.

Join Elefun's newest friend, the trouble-loving Chasin' Cheeky monkey in this ring-tossin' Chasin' Cheeky game. In this up-and-active game, Chasin' Cheeky will race around the room as you try to get your colored rings on his tail. Once you get all of your rings onto his tail, be the first to grab his banana and shake it with Chasin' Cheeky to celebrate your win.

Play again by putting the banana back in Cheeky's mouth.

Unitar is a simultanuous-choice 8 round 3 person strategy poker and, hopefully, the Arabic game.

Goal
You win Unitar by dominating the field with your color, in other words the game color with the highest number of frames on the playing field wins.

Strategy
Each turn, every player selects one block of stones that will be moved or rotated. By doing so, blocks may start to overlap. When blocks overlap, actions can be selected to eliminate the overlapping pieces, or to unify the two blocks, which means that the squares they occupy are divided amongst the two colors.

Poker 
You have to guess your opponent's intended moves, because your own intended move will only be performed if it shares two characteristics with the other player's moves.

Players take turns in taking pieces of treasure from the pouch and put these on the flying carpet. The carpet is staying in the air by the power of the magnet. If the magnet fails the carpet falls and the player causing the falling loses.

"The Eng Chiang" is a board game, that combines a Taiwanese retro game with a common snack food, roasted sausage.It is a very interesting and effective ice-breaker for events and gatherings.
Welcome to the sausage world of Taiwan!

The players put together a sausage with "The Eng Chiang Tao" Card x2 "The Eng Chiang" Card x8.

Starting with the Dealer, each player takes turn clockwise in rolling the dices.

The player who rolls the largest number takes sausage of the player who rolls the smallest number.

When a player could only put together a "mini sausage" (with only eng chiang tao card),the player with the longest sausage wins a Garlic,and the game resets to the next round.

Goal
a. A player who obtains three Garlics wins.
b. A player who obtains the most Garlics within 30 mins wins.

What other people think of you?

Do you know yourself or not?

Through this game, you can understand how others think of you .

Straight Talk is a simple party game, it is very adapt to play with your friends and families, and to explore what they think of you?

Every player will take some cards from other players, and you can't see that cards.

Then each player take turns to guess what cards they have.
ex. "Am I Smart?" "NO~~you are not!"or "Yes! you are"

The winner is the first person to guess all the cards.

In Project Mars you work as a space industry contractor racing to be the first company with the technology and engineering levels to send humans to Mars. 

It's not going to be easy as there are a number of challenges to overcome in order to accomplish a manned trip to the red planet, for one, it's only feasible to make an attempt every 2 years (actually closer to 26 months) for the most optimal alignment of Earth and Mars.

Next there is the challenge of getting all the necessary items you'll need for the trip free of Earth's atmosphere. This can't be done in one shot - so multiple missions will be necessary, taking fuel and modules up to low Earth orbit (LEO) on separate trips where they can then be assembled into a spacecraft that has everything needed to do the job.

And let's not forget money – it costs a lot to make all this happen!

Place your modules in low Earth orbit by increasing your engineering level, while managing your resources, expanding your office space, working with the best vendors and hiring the most capable employees for the job.

Objective
Be the first player to place 2 fuel depots and 3 modules in low Earth orbit and have the engineering level necessary to acquire the Launch Date card.

Win/Lose Revolution is a very light social deduction game for 3 players.  Each player is dealt one of the three role cards and secretly looks at the card.  The player with the Controller card turns the card face up and then must pick one other player to go on a mission.   The players with the Rebel and Informant cards will try to convince the Controller to pick them (without showing their card).

If the Controller picks the Rebel, both those players win.  If the Controller picks the Informant, the Informant player wins.

The game can be expanded to 4-5 players with a second set.

Not to be confused with bezzerwizzer kompakt. This version contains no board.

BEZZERWIZZER Kompakt is a new way to play BEZZERWIZZER that makes it easier to play on the go, at the beach or anywhere else for that sake.

The game contains 150 cards with questions in the same 20 categories as the original game, which means that they can be used as new challenges in the original game as well.

To start with the players are divided into two to six teams. Each team can consist of one or more players. Each team then gets a bezzerwizzer token that can be used once per round (see below).

Now the game starts: Each team picks a token at random out of the included bag. There are 20 tokens - one for each category in the game. The token must be kept secret from the other players. The first team to go then choose either to answer a question in the category on their token or to swap with one of the other teams, without knowing what they will get. If they answer the question that they end up with correctly, they will receive 3 points - a wrong answer does nothing. Scoring is kept on the included pad. This continues till all teams have answered a question. The last team will not have the opportunity to swap, as all other teams have used up their categories.

Each turn, each of the teams have one opportunity to bezzerwizze one of the other teams question. This means that if the team does not answer the question correctly, the team that has bezzerwizze'd has a chance to answer it as well. If the first team answers correctly however, the other team will have wasted their chance to bezzerwizze this round. The number of points you get for bezzerwizzing and answering correct depends on when you choose to do it; if you choose to bezzerwizze after the category is revealed, but before the question is read aloud you will get 2 points for a correct answer. If you do it after the question has been read aloud, you will only get 1 point for a correct answer. If the teams that bezzerwizzet can not answer correctly either, the original team will receive the points.

The turn order then switches one place and the process starts again. If there are fewer category tokens in the bag than the number of teams when a new turn is started, all of the tokens are returned to the bag.

The game ends when one of the teams has 20 points (continuing the round to completion to allow other teams to reach 20 as well). Alternately, teams can choose to only play until the bag is empty.

Based on the hit video game, players have the opportunity to mine, craft or reserve to win.

Players "mine" Resource Cards of Wood, Stone, Iron, Diamond, or Gold, and then use those cards to "craft" Craft Cards for points. If you desire a certain Craft Card, but are currently unable to pay for it, you may Reserve the card in your card holder to craft later. Craft Cards can become Tools with special powers you can you can use in your favor to control the game play—but watch out! TNT and Creeper cards are hiding in the deck for unexpected upsets.

The player who reaches the game point goal first, wins.
A race to the finish game with a beautifully lithographed board featuring a land of monsters, wild beasts and fairy tale creatures. Players draw cards to move.

Players choose one of the Cowboy/Cowgirl character disks that have been punched out of the insert. Game also includes 12 orange slice disks and a punch out spinner with an inner and outer ring.

Players begin on the Starting House and move forward by the number of spaces on the outer ring of the spinner. When a player lands on an orange slice space, they receive an orange slice piece and spin again, this time using the inner ring of the spinner. Players continue until someone reaches the Candy House. The first player in the Candy House gets 2 orange slices. The player who has the most orange slices at this point, wins.

On the other side of the board is a checkerboard, and black and red checkers can be punched out of the insert, as well.

A starship travelling through the farthest reaches of space has flown into a vast field of orbital mines. Its defense systems are more than capable of destroying the mines, yet the small devices are equipped with an A.I. module - now they are trying to surround and annihilate the starship. Which side shall prevail in this deadly duel?

Players will move tiles (starship for one and mines for the other) on a space map and they will try to compete in order to achieve their result: pass the orbital mines fields without any relevant damage or destroy the starship.

This is a promotional Game: Black Stories given out for free at the publisher's booth at SPIEL Essen 2015. It will be contained in the upcoming Black Stories Scary Music Edition.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

The promo story can be played on its own, without any actual Black Stories edition.

Players take on the role of a thief attempting to obtain priceless treasures and outdo their fellow gentleman and lady burglars. Two to five players take turns picking locks to steal valuable items from the vault or each other. The thief with the most treasures at the end of the game is the winner.

Each treasure obtained puts you closer to winning. However, each treasure has a special negative effect that makes your collection vulnerable. Steal wisely, certain combinations of treasures in your possession could make it easier for other thieves to steal from you.

The main mechanic of Pick the Lock has a small amount of wit and a lot of luck. Players attempt to steal treasures from each other or the vault by using one of their five number cards. These cards are numbered four through eight. When played they define the odds of success during your attempt to steal a treasure. The defending player sets the combination of the lock to his or her vault by placing a card face down that is from 1 to the number the attacking player has played. Using the right cards with the right treasure effects could ensure your victory. Pick the Lock combines a nice blend of strategy, wit, and luck. Are you clever enough to outwit your friends and Pick the Lock?

Pick the Lock is a Card game for 2-5 players ages 6 and up.

This is kind of a soccer training simulation. One goal keeper (red) plays against up to 3 field players (yellow, black, green). Movement is determined by a die. The goal keeper has 9 meeples and each field player has 3 meeples. The goal keeper tries to catch the field players and vice versa by getting on the same space. If the goal keeper has lost all his meeples the first field player to reach the square goal space wins the game. The goal keeper wins if the catches all field players.

The city is full of fine foods.  You love to go out with your friends, wandering around and eating tasty things.  But you might have overdone it a bit.  You're all feeling a bit plump lately.  One of you speaks up: "Let's all dieting contest!  Whoever loses the most weight wins!"

And so it begins.  A pleasant game of watching what you eat while you stroll the streets and dine together.  If you feel an item has too many calories, pass it off on a friend.  Try to be the first to reach your goal.

The players collect food cards, trying to keep the cards lowest in fat while passing off the unhealthy cards to their friends.  Whoever empties their hands first scores zero, while the other players count the amount of weight gained in their remaining cards.  After everyone has been start player once, whoever has gained the least weight wins.

What could be more fun then Trading good in the Mediterranean? It happens when you combine LCR components to create YADE (Yet Another Dry Euro). Move you ship from port to port and discover the shipping needs. Do the best job of matching the needs to win with the most Victory Points!

Objective: To have your sea ports end the game with the most total value in goods Shipped to it, and insuring that your home port has more value then your sister ports.

Game-Play: Players will take turns Useing dice to Launch/Land from port to port. While there they peak at the requested good and attempt to marry the right goods card in following turns. After the first chip is revealed take ownership of the port and begin to fill orders. Look out for other players that chose to mess with your effort at the port. They can improve the value of a sister port or try and ruin your home port value.

A Game: Black Stories edition with stories from the Bible.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

This game recreate the first democratic elections in spain in 1977 after Franco period. Each player choose a political party and start with money for the political campaign. Roll the die and move your counter on the map. If you finish the movement on a city square, you remove and take a square counter wich represents votes, if not some event happens, . The game finish when all votes have been removed from the board. The player with more votes and secondary money wins the game.
Diametric is an abstract co-operative card game. The game consists of only 18 cards and uses hidden information to provide a challenge for 2 or 3 players.

Abstract strategy game for two players, played on a 6x6 square board.

Each player has a pawn. Initially, the pawns are placed on the c6 and d1 squares.

In each turn, players move own pawn to adjacent square, and then place a cube in any square. The cube can stacked up to three levels.

Pawn can move vertically, horizontally and diagonally. In addition, pawn can climb to the cube on one level. However, pawn can not go down the level, climb two levels at once or climb on top of the three levels of the cube.

A player win if the opponent's pawn can not move.

Throw the die and move your pawn between the shops. Take a card with a letter, you have to say a word in 20 seconds, which begins with the letter taken and you can find in the shop you finished the movement. If you win, you earn money; if you lose, you leave your money.

Whoever earns the most money wins.

INTRODUCTION

Vault is an abstract game in which each player tries to reach the opponent’s back rank. Vault is named after pole vaulting, which is a track and field event in which a person uses a long, flexible pole as an aid to jump over a bar. Vault is a derivative of Onager, by the same designer and uses a variation of its jumping mechanism (also present in Billabong, for example) that allows multiple directions to be used. It’s like vector movement but without acceleration. Unlike Onager, Vault only works well on a square grid, as jumping directions are difficult to visualize in a hexagonal grid.

MATERIAL

- A square grid with an even number of cells (recommended 10x10). Preferably checkered* for clarity, but this is not mandatory.
- As many white and black pawns as the number of cells per side.

SETUP

Each player has an allocated colour (Black or White). Fill your nearest row with pawns of your colour (one per cell).
 HOW TO PLAY

White starts. Players alternate turns during the game until the victory condition is reached. On your turn, either walk or jump with one of your pawns.

Walk

Move one of your pieces to an adjacent empty space as a King in Chess.

Jump

In order to jump, choose 2 friendly pieces. One of the pieces then jumps over the other piece in the direction defined by both pawns, landing on a space beyond that is at a distance equal to the distance between the two friendly pieces before the jump was made (like a mirror). Notice that jumping is not restricted to orthogonal or diagonal directions.

The landing space must be either empty or occupied by an enemy piece, which is then captured and removed from the game. A piece cannot land on a friendly piece. Pieces cannot land outside the board.

Notice that the spaces between the jumping pawn and the landing space don’t need to be empty. Also, captures can only be made by jumping.

GAME END

If at the start of your turn you have at least one piece on your opponent's back rank then you have won.

If the above condition is not reached and you can’t make a legal movement at the start of your turn, you lose. This rarely happens. Players may agree on a draw at any moment during the game.

NOTES FROM THE DESIGNER

This is intended to be the simplest game that uses this jumping mechanism. I’ve decided not to use Onager’s stacking mechanism (in order to make is simpler for turn based online play and also playable with non-stacking pieces) or the multiple jump (as it would be almost impossible to think ahead).

As a variant, you can use the stacking mechanism of Onager.

(*) On a checkered board, the jumping piece always lands in a space of the same colour as the starting one.

Jack Attack is a trick-taking game with an augmented deck, described by the publisher as "combining the best elements of Spades, Hearts, and Bridge." The deck contains the standard 52 cards, plus 4 suited "1"s, 2 "Big" Jokers, and 2 "Little" Jokers.

The object is to avoid  taking Jacks, although a player may collect all four for a "Grand Slam", similar to shooting the moon in Hearts.

The players are dealt a number of cards dependent on the number of players. The dealer determines trump/no trump, and makes the opening lead. Suit must be followed, with the exception of the Jokers, which may be played on any trick. Trick is won (in order of precedence) by the first "Big" Joker, highest trump, or highest card of the suit led. ("Little" Jokers cannot win tricks.)

Play continues until one person has taken 10 Jacks, or 10 hands have been played. Low score wins. ("Grand Slams" alter this somewhat.)

Bowling Dice Game is a simple "push your luck" game based on Bowling.

Roll 1 normal dice and count the pips. 
If you roll a 6 then it's an instant Strike or spare regardless of previous counted pips.

You can stop rerolling whenever you want and enter the score in the scoresheet.

After a Strike or spare you get bounspoints from the next rounds

Highest score wins.

Gujuguju is a fast, easy and fun party game with a unique rule.

Start with a number of fruit cards face up on the table, then divide the other cards equally among the players. On a turn, a player names one of the four types of fruit in the game, then flips over a card from their deck onto a face-up card of this type. If they reveal the same type of fruit that they named, everyone races to cover all of these fruits with cards from their personal deck. Whoever rids their hand of cards first wins!

Délirolinguo is as the Tower of Babel! This party game invites you to discover 30 common phrases in 12 languages: English, Spanish, Italian, German, Arabic, Japanese, Portuguese, Mandarin Chinese, Hindi, Russian, Turkish and French.

Rules of the Game: Unmask the language that opponents have!

The game starts with a card showing expressions in all 12 languages. To win, you just have to read this term to your opponents in the language that they have. Each opponent checks the answer on his card in his language and answers "yes" in case of right answer and "no" on error.

If you're right, you choose a Language card of one of your opponents to start your collection.

The winner of the game is the one that has the largest collection of languages. He will become a "polyglot genius".

DéliroLinguo, the languages game â€‹â€‹which makes you totally crazy!

Material: 24 Language cards, 30 Expressions cards, 16 Special cards, 1 hourglass, 1 pencil, 1 notebook

---

Délirolinguo, c’est un peu l’auberge espagnole ! Ce jeu d'ambiance vous propose de découvrir 30 expressions usuelles dans 12 langues : l’anglais, l’espagnol, l’italien, l’allemand, l’arabe, le japonais, le portugais, le chinois mandarin, l’hindi, le russe, le turc et le français.
La règle du jeu ? Démasquer les langues que les adversaires ont piochées !
La partie commence avec une carte présentant une expression dans chacune des 12 langues. Pour gagner, il suffit de lire ce terme à ses adversaires dans la langue que ces derniers auront pioché. Chaque adversaire vérifie la réponse sur sa carte et répond dans sa langue : « oui » en cas de réponse juste et « non » en cas d’erreur.
S’il vise juste, il choisit une des cartes « langues » d’un de ses adversaires pour commencer sa collection.
Le gagnant de la partie est celui qui aura la plus importante collection de langues. Il deviendra ainsi un « polyglotte de génie ».

DéliroLinguo, le jeu de langues qui rend complètement fou !

Matériel : 24 cartes Langue, 30 cartes Expressions, 16 cartes Joker, 1 sablier, 1 crayon, 1 carnet

Every player has ten tiles in his bag. One with four cats, two with three cats, three with two cats and four with one cat. On your turn you draw a tile from your bag and place it on the table with the goal being having ten of your cats in a row.

Climbing game using wooden tiles numbered from one to nine in four suits in descending order of strength: Suns, Moons, Stars and Clouds. There are also four Jokers. Tiles are divided evenly between players and everyone gets a Joker. The player with One of Clouds starts. You're playing singles, pairs, three of a kinds or straights of two or three. The first player to get rid of his tiles wins.

Going Ashore is a solitaire deck building game where you play the part of the Marines carrying out a series of battles as you hop from island to island. You must defeat all of the enemies on each island before you can move to the next. Clear the enemy from five islands to claim victory, any other result will re-write history as a loss for the allied forces!

- Publisher's blurb

One day the Humans had fiddled with the Earth until it could take no more, and the Humans ended. Then the Voles created their civilization and fiddled with the smaller things of the Earth until the Voles ended as well. Now the tiny creatures of the forest compete to find the artifacts and knowledge left by the fallen empires so that they too can mess it all up in their turn.

Each game of Vasty Wilds begins with a randomly placed network of Root cards. The players add cards to the board to expand the forest. Each card placement includes movement and other beneficial effects (Progress) for the player and detrimental effects (Misfortune) for her opponents. A player's opponents are in charge of placing her objectives in inconvenient places on the board. The player who collects all of her objectives first wins.

While Vasty Wilds is easy to learn for younger players or beginners, successive plays will reveal more complex strategies for card placement and effect combinations.

Lead Rome to greatness and become its first Emperor!

In Triumph, you want to turn the Roman Republic from a small city into a vast empire as the leader of a great noble family. Vie for dominance on every front of the Republic's life, and outmaneuver your rivals as you compete for power and prestige. Vanquish all external enemies and secure new provinces for the glory of Rome. Will you rise to the challenge and lead your family to ultimate triumph?

With a deck of cards representing your family's most illustrious figures, you'll bid to secure the offices of consuls, praetors, and censors. Those will, in turn, provide you with clients, gold, and legions to govern provinces, lead successful military campaigns, and control key sites within Rome itself – all to gain enough prestige to proclaim yourself the first Emperor of Rome!

Elementos is a fast-paced strategy game for two. Rules are easy and quick to learn but unleash a game with surprising strategic depth.

Elementos is about setting traps and thinking ahead.  It's a head to head challenge taking place in a natural setting.

The idea behind Elementos is simple. We play in a world of 3 fundamental elements: Fire, water and a tree.. The 3 different elements complete a life cycle; fire takes tree, tree takes water, and water takes fire; the elements create a comfy state of equilibrium.  Thing is, each game piece is actually a two faced deceiving character since game pieces can be flipped to reveal a different element on their other side known only to their master.
These elements are potential carriers of your wand, which is the real star of the game.

Be the first player to advance the wand to the other side of the board – and you become an Elemaster, a winner of the game.

The game is portable, and all game parts are made of wood with top quality prints (silkscreened).

Are you ready to participate in the wildest rally race in the world? In RallyRas, players play in pairs — with one being the driver and the other the navigator — with them trying to complete a circuit as quickly as possible despite their communication problems. Each turn (lap), players must use a keyword to communicate, and the same word with different vowels indicates different things, e.g. "bango" -> right and "bengo" -> left. Each lap, the navigator flips cards with road signs (direction, gear, etc.), then tries to communicate these things to the driver via keywords. (With an odd number of players, the couples change after each turn.)

•••

En RallyRas viviréis pequeños problemas de comunicación. Con ayuda de las cartas los jugadores tendréis que lograr entenderos, recorrer el circuito sin atropellos y llegar a la meta lo antes posible.

¿Preparados para participar en el rally más divertido del mundo? ¡¡Arranca!!

Los jugadores jugarán por parejas, uno será el piloto y otro el copiloto. Con jugadores impares las parejas se alternan cada turno.

Cada turno (etapa) utilizarán una palabra clave, sin una vocal, para comunicarse. Dependiendo con qué vocal la digan y cómo la palabra dará una indicación diferente. (Ej, BANGO -> derecha, BENGO -> izquierda)

En un etapa, el copiloto dará la vuelta a las cartas con las indicaciones de carretera (dirección, marcha y trazada especial) y utilizará la palabra clave para indicar al piloto lo que hay en las cartas.

You were aboard the yacht "Northern Pride", which a small group of friends had chartered for a party that night off the shores of New England. The group asked the Captain to take the boat way out to sea, away from any lights so they could party under the stars and maybe see the Northern Lights put on a show. When the boat set out, it was a clear, pleasant evening and the sea was calm. The Captain did mention something about a possible storm front that was due to move in early the next morning.

For hours, the party aboard the boat had enjoyed themselves. Then someone noticed the stars had all disappeared, and the stillness of the sea was quickly turning into gale force winds. The storm front had moved in faster than anyone could have expected. A sudden microburst tore the boat to pieces, plunging you all into the sea.

Now you all find yourselves sitting atop a piece of the boat, bobbing in the water, somewhere in the Atlantic Ocean. Scattered in the water all around you, are pieces and debris from the boat. As it all happened so fast, the Captain had no chance to radio for help. You realize it may be some time before you are rescued, and you will need to survive until then.

To survive (and win the game) you must find a flotation device, a signaling device, a water source, and a food source. To find your survival tools, you will have to swim around searching the sea for floating parts. You might even have to might have to steal parts from others, or withhold parts from them to save yourself.

Survive being awash at sea by using deduction, hand management and memory.

This game uses cards as boat pieces, and floating debris. It comes with 6 player tokens to move from card (boat piece or swim card) to card. Each turn you have 2 strokes to move. As the game progresses it takes more strokes to move as the pieces are drifting further apart.

The rumors are true!  The Crypt King has shown up on the edge of civilization with a legion of undead.  On this border, an old Tavern named Haunted Oak has re-lit it's fires.  The Elf Champion and his many allies are starting to fill the tavern and getting ready to face this new threat.

In Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #3 , up to four players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern. Each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

Only one deck is needed for up to four players; extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share. Game Pack #3 can be played separately or with Game Pack #1 and #2. TCG is for 'the card game'

Surrender Unto Caesar is the 17th game in the Pocket Battles series of games from LPS, Inc.

Surrender Unto Caesar is a complete mini-game with map and rules (on the back of the postcard) and counters which need to be cut out. Also needed for play is a standard deck of playing cards and 1D6.

The game goes for 4 turns, divided into multiple rounds. Players each draw a card to determine who goes first that round. A turn ends when both Jokers have been drawn from the deck.

The map is divided into Siege Wall Areas (SWA), and each player takes one action (sometimes two actions, occasionally none) in any one SWA. Actions cause combat losses or reduce Roman/Gallic Resistance Levels (RRL/GRL). A player loses once their RL reaches 0. The Gallic player also wins if at the end of any turn Vercingetorix is in a SWA free of Roman infantry units. If the Gallic player hasn't won by the end of turn 4, the Roman player wins.

From the game box:
"Today is your neighborhood swap meet! Dozens of folks have hauled their unwanted stuff into their driveways. Swap your old stuff you don’t want for… well, more old stuff, but old stuff you’d rather have. Be warned, there are other bargain hunters out there too! Go too slow and you lose the deal. Go too fast and you might miss out on the ultimate swap!"

This game was created as an educational tool to teach students about unit conversion. Players start with certain goods and play cards to convert (swap) those goods into other goods, for example Comic Books to DVDs. Players are competing to complete a Deal by chaining swaps to a shared Goal and collect points based on the number of cards used in the Deal. Play continues for a number of rounds and the player with the most points win.

A nice simple and fun game for kids of all ages. Each player spins the wooden wheel to collect robot parts. The first player to assemble his small robot wins. The box contains 1 wooden roller tray, 24 wooden magnetic pieces (4 robots), 1 set of rules.

Mix and match dragon, vampire, and werewolf body parts to create a fearsome gladiator that you will pit against your opponents' creations. Fight to the death against the other monsters in a limb rending battle that only ends when one heart remains beating.

The game has two distinct phases, first you draft all of the body parts between all players, and build your monster with the parts you've drafted. Then players take turns attacking each other using an innovative system where the limb you use to attack dictates which area (upper, middle, lower) of your monster will be vulnerable to the next attack aimed at you.

Combat continues as limbs take damage and eventually fall off. If an attack targets a space that is missing a limb it goes through to the torso, once your torso is destroyed you are out of the game.

Each body part has a thematic offensive or defensive battle effect which adds to replay value as you explore all of the possible monster combinations.

Publisher Blurb:

Baseball Highlights: 2045 is like watching TV highlights of early 21st-century baseball games, with the gameplay being full of theme with no outs or innings and without bogging down in a play-by-play baseball simulation. In this quick and interactive game, two players build their teams as they play, combining both strategy (building your team) and tactics (playing the game) without any of the downtime. Game includes regular head to head play as well as solitaire and 3 player variants and the means to play 4 player tournaments. The game also supports combining boxes for even larger tournaments. 1-4 players 45 minute play time. The Super Deluxe Edition comes with seven mini expansions: Naturals Magna Glove, Cyborg Pitchers, Robot Hitters, Rally Cap, Coaches, Big Fly!, and Errors!.

Smarten-Up is a game based on health and nutrition.  The game consists of 6 packs of question and answer cards with 48 cards in each deck, 1 die, 2 score pads, 1 pen, and one rule/reference sheet. Each deck has a different colour back and a different point value.

The players roll the die to determine which deck to draw from. The starting player asks the question on the card to the player on the left. If the player answers the question correctly, they earn the full point value of the card. If the player fails to answer correctly, the asking player may score half of the point value themselves, or ask the question of the player on the first player's left. If that player answers the question correctly, they score full points. If the player fails to answer correctly, the asking player scores full points (except for true and false questions).

Some cards are bonus cards. The asking player reads the cards and gives the points to the player on the left. These two players then exchange places. This eliminates any possible preferred table positions. The game ends at a predetermined time or when a predetermined point value is reached. The player with the highest score is the winner.
